dict.string: Review

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device’s built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from Play mode.
Tap here to rate and review this app.
Feel good as a result of helping others benefit from this app. Your rating and review of this app helps others discover it.
About

Guided Video LLC was founded by parents who work together to develop apps for their own families, which include very young children and children with special needs.
We test this app using our own families, friends, educators, and special needs professionals. But even so, every child is different, including yours. So, we really do want to learn your comments and constructive criticism. Please do not hesitate to tap the Contact button. We truly want to hear from you, even if it’s only a single word of feedback. You’ll inspire us to keep making the app better for the sake of all children.
Another way you can help is to rate and review this app. Your rating and review of this app helps others discover it. Feel good about helping others by tapping the Review button now.

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device’s built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from Play mode.

Privacy is an issue Guided Video LLC takes very seriously. The GUIDED VIDEO app never transfers your photos and videos from your device. Don’t worry we hate SPAM, too. To learn more about how Guided Video LLC works with these matters, goto www.guidedvideo.com/privacy.
Tap here to rate and review this app.
AlternativeViewController
Use this section to define an ALTERNATIVE BUTTON

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device’s built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from Play mode.
Configure ALTERNATIVE Button

Tap SAVE to retain changes to the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON and return to the prior section.
Tap the back button to return to the prior section without retaining any changes to the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON.
Tap DELETE ALTERNATIVE to erase the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON and return to the prior section.

Enter text describing the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON. The text is optional and appears only in the CONFIGURE mode.
Pick an image for the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON. This image is what will be seen in PLAY mode. The image may be picked from the device's photo library or may be created using the device's camera.
Choose the SUBSEQUENT ACTION. The choice is to replay the original INSTRUCTION VIDEO or play the next INSTRUCTION VIDEO. If the choice is to play the next INSTRUCTION VIDEO and there is no subsequent INSTRUCTION VIDEO, then when in PLAY mode, the Guided Video app treats this as the end of the SUBJECT.

An ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is available to be tapped after an INSTRUCTION VIDEO begins playing. An ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is labelled with an image. When an ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is tapped, its ALTERNATIVE VIDEO is played. After the ALTERNATIVE VIDEO has played, either the original INSTRUCTION VIDEO repeats, or the next INSTRUCTION VIDEO plays. When there is no INSTRUCTION VIDEO to be played next, the list of available SUBJECT appears.
An INSTRUCTION VIDEO plays automatically. An INSTRUCTION VIDEO may repeat depending on the configuration of the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON that is subsequently tapped.
A SUBJECT is a group of one or more INSTRUCTION VIDEOS. A SUBJECT is labelled with both an image and with characters of text.
A SUBJECT is shown in black in the diagram nearby.
An INSTRUCTION VIDEO or ALTERNATIVE VIDEO is shown in blue in the diagram nearby.
ALTERNATIVE BUTTONS are shown in red in the diagram nearby.
Missing or incomplete ALTERNATIVE BUTTON
Use this section to chose whether to create a new ALTERNATIVE BUTTON or revise an existing ALTERNATIVE BUTTON
Select Alternative Button
AlternativeListViewController

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device’s built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from Play mode.
Tap the back button to return to the prior section

Tap an existing ALTERNATIVE BUTTON to revise it
Tap to "ADD A NEW ALTERNATIVE BUTTON..."

An ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is available to be tapped after an INSTRUCTION VIDEO begins playing. An ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is labelled with an image. When an ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is tapped, its ALTERNATIVE VIDEO is played. After the ALTERNATIVE VIDEO has played, either the original INSTRUCTION VIDEO repeats, or the next INSTRUCTION VIDEO plays. When there is no INSTRUCTION VIDEO to be played next, the list of available SUBJECT appears.
An INSTRUCTION VIDEO plays automatically. An INSTRUCTION VIDEO may repeat depending on the configuration of the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON that is subsequently tapped.
A SUBJECT is a group of one or more INSTRUCTION VIDEOS. A SUBJECT is labelled with both an image and with characters of text.
A SUBJECT is shown in black in the diagram nearby.
An INSTRUCTION VIDEO or ALTERNATIVE VIDEO is shown in blue in the diagram nearby.
ALTERNATIVE BUTTONS are shown in red in the diagram nearby.
Missing image or video for the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON
Use this section to define an INSTRUCTION VIDEO
Configure Instruction Video
InstructionViewController

Tap NEXT to save changes to the INSTRUCTION VIDEO and go to the next section.
Tap the back button to return to the prior section without saving any changes to the INSTRUCTION VIDEO.
Tap DELETE INSTRUCTION to erase the INSTRUCTION VIDEO and return to the prior section.

Enter text describing the INSTRUCTION VIDEO. The text is optional and appears only in the CONFIGURE mode.
Pick a video. The video may be picked from the device's photo library or may be created using the device's camera.

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device’s built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from Play mode.

SubjectViewController

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device's built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from PLAY mode.

Enter text describing the SUBJECT. The text is optional and will be seen in PLAY mode.
Pick an image for the SUBJECT. This image will be seen in PLAY mode. The image may be picked from the device's photo library or may be created using the device's camera.

Tap NEXT to save changes to the SUBJECT and go to the next section.
Tap the back button to return to the prior section without saving any changes to the SUBJECT.
Tap DELETE SUBJECT to erase the SUBJECT and return to the prior section.
Missing image for SUBJECT, or missing INSTRUCTION VIDEO or ALTERNATIVE BUTTON
Use this section to choose whether to create a new Subject or revise an existing SUBJECT.
Configure [aka Select Subject]

Guided Video app is designed to work with this device’s built-in Guided Access function. Tap Settings > General > Accessibility > Guided Access to turn off motion. When motion is turned off, the Guided Video app cannot be shaken to exit from Play mode.
SubjectListViewController

Tap an existing SUBJECT to revise it.
Tap to ‘ADD A NEW SUBJECT...’
To exit, tap any button in the left pane.
Missing image for SUBJECT, or the INSTRUCTION VIDEO or ALTERNATIVE BUTTON is incomplete

When there is no INSTRUCTION VIDEO to be played next, the list of available SUBJECT appears.
An INSTRUCTION VIDEO plays automatically. An INSTRUCTION VIDEO may repeat depending on the configuration of the ALTERNATIVE BUTTON that is subsequently tapped.
